preqs: PHY2011 and PHY2032; or both BMS1052 and BMS2031; or at the discretion of the unit coordinator.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {PHY2011, PHY2021, PHY2032} OR  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {BMS1052, BMS2031} OR  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BND2011})
(Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {PHY2011, PHY2032} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {BMS1052, BMS2031})

description: Explores cutting-edge research in the detailed study of reproduction including hormonal control, ovarian and menstrual cycles, fertilization and reproductive diseases. The course considers how various physiological states such as body weight, stress and aging influence reproduction. Details current research ideas on normal function and dysfunction in this area, and new technologies. Emphasis is on assisted self-directed learning and project based learning.
